languages.text: "И это даже не конец еще! Комендант Кастелья, значит, из своих покоев съехал, да стал жить прямо в карьере под куполом. И ему, видать, головушку там напекло. Он уже совсем дичь понес, что, мол, оптиматы — это святые, им будет истина такая-сякая открыта. Ну и стал их к себе в карьер забирать. Возвращались не все. А кто возвращался — те совсем зверели. Людишек потрошить начали, как мясники. Охрану даже. И надзирателей. Их комендант сам вооружил! Вот чем все закончилось. А я сразу, еще по указу про ужины понял — быть беде!"

"And that wasn't even the end of it! Warden Casteglia moved out of his chambers to live right in the quarry, under the dome. And I think something in his new home really scrambled his brain. He began spouting the wildest things like 'the optimates are saints' who will 'behold the truth.' And he started taking them to the quarry. Not all of them returned. The ones who did, you wouldn't recognise them, more beast than man. They were butchering people left and right. Even guards. And overseers. The warden himself had armed them! And that's the whole sob story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."
languages.original_text: "И это даже не конец еще! Комендант Кастелья, значит, из своих покоев съехал, да стал жить прямо в карьере под куполом. И ему, видать, головушку там напекло. Он уже совсем дичь понес, что, мол, оптиматы — это святые, им будет истина такая-сякая открыта. Ну и стал их к себе в карьер забирать. Возвращались не все. А кто возвращался — те совсем зверели. Людишек потрошить начали, как мясники. Охрану даже. И надзирателей. Их комендант сам вооружил! Вот чем все закончилось. А я сразу, еще по указу про ужины понял — быть беде!"

traits.locale_text: "And that wasn't even the end of it! Warden Casteglia moved out of his chambers to live right in the quarry, under the dome. And I think something in his new home really scrambled his brain. He began spouting the wildest things like 'the optimates are saints' who will 'behold the truth.' And he started taking them to the quarry. Not all of them returned. The ones who did came back as savage beasts. They were butchering people left and right. Even guards. And overseers. The warden himself had armed them! And that's the whole sad story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

"And that wasn't even the end of it! Warden Casteglia moved out of his chambers to live right in the quarry, under the dome. And I think something in his new home really scrambled his brain. He began spouting the wildest things like 'the optimates are saints' who will 'behold the truth.' And he started taking them to the quarry. Not all of them returned. The ones who did came back as savage beasts. They were butchering people left and right. Even guards. And overseers. The warden himself had armed them! And that's the whole sad story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

And that's the whole sob story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

And that's the whole sob story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

"And that wasn't even the end of it! Warden Casteglia moved out of his chambers to live right in the quarry, under the dome. And I think something in his new home really scrambled his brain. He began spouting the wildest things like 'the optimates are saints' who will 'behold the truth.' And he started taking them to the quarry. Not all of them returned. The ones who did, you wouldn't recognise them, more beast than man. They were butchering people left and right. Even guards. And overseers. The warden himself had armed them! And that's the whole sob story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

"And that wasn't even the end of it! Warden Casteglia moved out of his chambers to live right in the quarry, under the dome. And I think something in his new home really scrambled his brain. He began spouting the wildest things like 'the optimates are saints' who will 'behold the truth.' And he started taking them to the quarry. Not all of them returned. The ones who did, you wouldn't recognise them, more beast than man. They were butchering people left and right. Even guards. And overseers. The warden himself had armed them! And that's the whole sob story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

languages.text: «¡Pero ahí no acabó todo! El alcaide Casteglia dejó sus aposentos para vivir en la cantera, bajo la cúpula. Y creo que su mente acabó trastornada por algo que había en su nuevo hogar. Comenzó a decir cosas de lo más descabelladas, como que los "optimates son santos" que "contemplarán la verdad". Y empezó a llevárselos a la cantera, pero no todos regresaban. Los que lo hicieron, estaban irreconocibles, más bestias que hombres. Mataban a la gente a diestro y siniestro, incluso a los guardias y a los supervisores. ¡Fue el propio alcaide quien les proporcionó armas! Y este es el fin de esta triste historia. Pero yo lo supe desde el momento en que nos dejó cenar. Pensé: "no, esto no acabará bien"».
languages.original_text: "And that wasn't even the end of it! Warden Casteglia moved out of his chambers to live right in the quarry, under the dome. And I think something in his new home really scrambled his brain. He began spouting the wildest things like 'the optimates are saints' who will 'behold the truth.' And he started taking them to the quarry. Not all of them returned. The ones who did, you wouldn't recognise them, more beast than man. They were butchering people left and right. Even guards. And overseers. The warden himself had armed them! And that's the whole sob story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

traits.locale_text: «¡Pero ahí no acabó todo! El alcaide Casteglia dejó sus aposentos para vivir en la cantera, bajo la cúpula. Y creo que su mente acabó trastornada por algo que había en su nuevo hogar. Comenzó a decir cosas de lo más descabelladas, como que los "optimates son santos" que "contemplarán la verdad". Y empezó a llevárselos a la cantera, pero no todos regresaban. Los que lo hicieron, estaban irreconocibles, más bestias que hombres. Mataban a la gente a diestro y siniestro, incluso a los guardias y a los supervisores. ¡Fue el propio alcaide quien les proporcionó armas! Y este es el fin de esta triste historia. Pero yo lo supe desde el momento en que nos dejó cenar. Pensé: "no, esto no acabará bien"».

languages.text: "Und das war noch nicht einmal alles! Direktor Casteglia ist aus seinen Gemächern ausgezogen, um im Steinbruch zu leben, unter der Kuppel. Und ich glaube, irgendetwas in seinem neuen Zuhause hat sein Gehirn endgültig zu Brei werden lassen. Er hat begonnen, völlig verrücktes Zeug zu reden. Dass die Optimaten 'Heilige' seien, die 'die Wahrheit sehen' würden. Und er hat begonnen, sie in den Steinbruch zu bringen. Nicht alle sind zurückgekehrt. Und die, die es sind, waren nicht wiederzuerkennen. Mehr Tier als Mensch. Sie haben reihenweise Leute abgeschlachtet. Selbst Wachen. Und Aufseher. Der Direktor selbst hatte sie mit Waffen ausgestattet! Und das ist die ganze traurige Geschichte. Aber ich wusste es von dem Augenblick an, als er uns das erste Abendessen serviert hat: Oh, das wird kein gutes Ende nehmen."
languages.original_text: "And that wasn't even the end of it! Warden Casteglia moved out of his chambers to live right in the quarry, under the dome. And I think something in his new home really scrambled his brain. He began spouting the wildest things like 'the optimates are saints' who will 'behold the truth.' And he started taking them to the quarry. Not all of them returned. The ones who did, you wouldn't recognise them, more beast than man. They were butchering people left and right. Even guards. And overseers. The warden himself had armed them! And that's the whole sob story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

traits.locale_text: "Und das war noch nicht einmal alles! Direktor Casteglia ist aus seinen Gemächern ausgezogen, um im Steinbruch zu leben, unter der Kuppel. Und ich glaube, irgendetwas in seinem neuen Zuhause hat sein Gehirn endgültig zu Brei werden lassen. Er hat begonnen, völlig verrücktes Zeug zu reden. dass die Optimaten 'Heilige' seien, die 'die Wahrheit sehen' würden. Und er hat begonnen, sie in den Steinbruch zu bringen. Nicht alle sind zurückgekehrt. Und die, die es sind, waren nicht wiederzuerkennen. Mehr Tier als Mensch. Sie haben reihenweise Leute abgeschlachtet. Selbst Wachen. Und Aufseher. Der Direktor selbst hatte sie mit Waffen ausgestattet! Und das ist die ganze traurige Geschichte. Aber ich wusste es von dem Augenblick an, als er uns das erste Abendessen serviert hat: Oh, das wird kein gutes Ende nehmen."

languages.text: « Et c'est même pas tout ! Le directeur Casteglia a quitté ses appartements pour aller s'installer dans la carrière, sous le dôme. Et à mon avis, un truc là-bas lui a particulièrement brouillé la cervelle. Il a commencé à raconter des histoires sans queue ni tête, que "les élus étaient des saints", qui "contempleraient la vérité". Et puis, il s'est mis à les emmener à la carrière... Certains n'en sont jamais revenus. Et pour ceux qui ont refait surface, ils étaient méconnaissables, presque comme des animaux. Ils massacraient les gens à tours de bras. Même les gardes. Et les superviseurs. Le directeur leur avait même donné des armes ! Voilà, vous savez tout. C'est pas franchement la joie, quoi. Dès qu'on a commencé à avoir droit à des soupers, je me suis dit que ça sentait le roussi. »
languages.original_text: "And that wasn't even the end of it! Warden Casteglia moved out of his chambers to live right in the quarry, under the dome. And I think something in his new home really scrambled his brain. He began spouting the wildest things like 'the optimates are saints' who will 'behold the truth.' And he started taking them to the quarry. Not all of them returned. The ones who did, you wouldn't recognise them, more beast than man. They were butchering people left and right. Even guards. And overseers. The warden himself had armed them! And that's the whole sob story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

traits.locale_text: « Et c'est même pas tout ! Le directeur Casteglia a quitté ses appartements pour aller s'installer dans la carrière, sous le dôme. Et à mon avis, un truc là-bas lui a particulièrement brouillé la cervelle. Il a commencé à raconter des histoires sans queue ni tête, que "les élus étaient des saints", qui "contempleraient la vérité". Et puis, il s'est mis à les emmener à la carrière... Certains n'en sont jamais revenus. Et pour ceux qui ont refait surface, ils étaient méconnaissables, presque comme des animaux. Ils massacraient les gens à tours de bras. Même les gardes. Et les superviseurs. Le directeur leur avait même donné des armes ! Voilà, vous savez tout. C'est pas franchement la joie, quoi. Dès qu'on a commencé à avoir droit à des soupers, je me suis dit que ça sentait le roussi. »

languages.text: “这还没完呢！后来，卡斯特格利亚典狱长搬出了他的房间，住到了穹顶下面的采石场里。我觉得他那个新窝里有什么东西把他脑子搞坏了，他开始胡言乱语，说什么‘典范都是圣徒’，他们‘将见证真相’，然后就把他们带到了采石场。有的人没能回来，而那些回来的人，变得一点人样都没有了。与其说是人，还不如说是畜生。他们开始到处杀人，甚至连看守和监工都杀。他们的武器是典狱长亲自交给他们的！这就是这里发生的惨剧。从他允许我们吃完晚饭那会儿，我就觉得这指定没好事。”
languages.original_text: "And that wasn't even the end of it! Warden Casteglia moved out of his chambers to live right in the quarry, under the dome. And I think something in his new home really scrambled his brain. He began spouting the wildest things like 'the optimates are saints' who will 'behold the truth.' And he started taking them to the quarry. Not all of them returned. The ones who did, you wouldn't recognise them, more beast than man. They were butchering people left and right. Even guards. And overseers. The warden himself had armed them! And that's the whole sob story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

traits.locale_text: “这还没完呢！后来，卡斯特格利亚典狱长搬出了他的房间，住到了穹顶下面的采石场里。我觉得他那个新窝里有什么东西把他脑子搞坏了，他开始胡言乱语，说什么‘典范都是圣徒’，他们‘将见证真相’，然后就把他们带到了采石场。有的人没能回来，而那些回来的人，变得一点人样都没有了。与其说是人，还不如说是畜生。他们开始到处杀人，甚至连看守和监工都杀。他们的武器是典狱长亲自交给他们的！这就是这里发生的惨剧。从他允许我们吃完晚饭那会儿，我就觉得这指定没好事。”

languages.text: 「そして、それで終わりじゃなかったんだ！カスティーリア所長は自分の部屋を出て、採石場の真下、ドームの下に住み始めた。その新しい家で何かが彼の脳を混乱させたんだろう。『オプティメイトたちは聖人だ』、『真実を見るだろう』なんて突飛なことを言い始めた。それで奴らを採石場に連れて行くようになったのさ。戻ってきたのは全員じゃない。戻ってきた者は人格が全く変わって、ありゃ人間というより野獣だったよ。そこにいる者を次々と虐殺していった。看守でも、刑務官でもお構いなしにな。所長自ら、奴らに武器を渡したんだぜ！お涙頂戴の話は、これですべてさ。だが俺は、所長が夕食を食わせてくれたときから勘づいていたよ。嫌な予感がするってな」
languages.original_text: "And that wasn't even the end of it! Warden Casteglia moved out of his chambers to live right in the quarry, under the dome. And I think something in his new home really scrambled his brain. He began spouting the wildest things like 'the optimates are saints' who will 'behold the truth.' And he started taking them to the quarry. Not all of them returned. The ones who did, you wouldn't recognise them, more beast than man. They were butchering people left and right. Even guards. And overseers. The warden himself had armed them! And that's the whole sob story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

traits.locale_text: 「しかもこれで終わりじゃない！カスティーリア所長は自室を出て、採石場の真下、ドームの下に住み始めた。俺は所長の新居の何かが、脳を掻き乱したと睨んでる。『真実を見る'であろう』聖人こそオプティマテス'とかとんでもない発言をするようになった。それで奴らを採石場に連れて行くくようになったのさ。戻ってきたのは全員じゃない。戻ってきた者は人が全く変わって、ありゃ人間というより野獣だよ。そこにいる者をちぎっては投げ、看守でも、刑務官でもお構いなしだ。奴らに武器を渡したのは所長なんだぜ！それが涙の物語の全てだよ。だが俺は所長が俺達に夕食を食わせてくれたときから勘づいていた。嫌な予感がするぜってね」

「そして、それで終わりじゃなかったんだ！カスティーリア所長は自分の部屋を出て、採石場の真下、ドームの下に住み始めた。その新しい家で何かが彼の脳を混乱させたんだろう。『オプティメイトたちは聖人だ』、『真実を見るだろう』なんて突飛なことを言い始めた。それで奴らを採石場に連れて行くようになったのさ。戻ってきたのは全員じゃない。戻ってきた者は人格が全く変わって、ありゃ人間というより野獣だったよ。そこにいる者を次々と虐殺していった。看守でも、刑務官でもお構いなしにな。所長自ら、奴らに武器を渡したんだぜ！お涙頂戴の話は、これですべてさ。だが俺は、所長が夕食を食わせてくれたときから勘づいていたよ。嫌な予感がするってな」

languages.text: "O kadarla da kalmadı! Müdür Casteglia, odasından çıkıp ocakta, kubbenin altında yaşamaya başladı. Galiba aklının ayarlarını bozan da o yeni evindeki bir şey oldu. 'Optimateler gerçeği görecek olan azizlerdir' gibi saçma şeyler söylemeye ve onları ocağa götürmeye başladı. Geri dönmeyenler oluyordu. Dönenler de tanınacak hâlde değildi, insandan çok canavar gibiydiler. Gardiyan, gözetmen ayırt etmeksizin ulu orta adam kesiyorlardı. Ellerine silahı da bizzat müdür vermiş! Acıklı hikâyemiz bu işte. Ama ben akşam yemeği vermeye başladıkları an demiştim, bu işin sonu iyi bitmez diye."
languages.original_text: "And that wasn't even the end of it! Warden Casteglia moved out of his chambers to live right in the quarry, under the dome. And I think something in his new home really scrambled his brain. He began spouting the wildest things like 'the optimates are saints' who will 'behold the truth.' And he started taking them to the quarry. Not all of them returned. The ones who did, you wouldn't recognise them, more beast than man. They were butchering people left and right. Even guards. And overseers. The warden himself had armed them! And that's the whole sob story. But I knew it from the moment he let us have dinners: oh, this won't end well."

'Optimateler gerçeği görecek olan azizlerdir' gibi saçma şeyler söylemeye ve onları ocağa götürmeye başladı. Geri dönmeyenler oluyordu. Dönenler de tanınacak hâlde değildi, insandan çok canavar gibiydiler. Gardiyan, gözetmen ayırt etmeksizin ulu orta adam kesiyorlardı. Ellerine silahı da bizzat müdür vermiş! Acıklı hikâyemiz bu işte. Ama ben akşam yemeği vermeye başladıkları an demiştim, bu işin sonu iyi bitmez diye."
